item.title: IMF warns on ending fiscal stimulus
item.description: The International Monetary Fund’s chief economist described a “nascent” global recovery, but warned that US policymakers walked a tightrope in timing the end of the fiscal stimulus

item.title: Germany likely to avoid big job losses
item.description: Germany looks likely to emerge from this year’s brutal downturn without suffering a large-scale increase in unemployment thanks to the government’s policy of subsidising wages, economists said

item.title: Attacks defy Afghan peace efforts
item.description: Election officials in Afghanistan on Tuesday braced themselves for one of the world’s most challenging polls as Taliban insurgents escalated their offensive on Kabul, the country’s capital, ahead of Thursday’s vote

item.title: Backlash grows on Obama’s health reform
item.description: The Obama administration was scrambling to contain a growing backlash from liberal Democrats that could prove fatal to his hopes of pushing through healthcare reform.

item.title: Wall Street stages modest rebound
item.description: US stocks staged a modest rebound after the steepest decline in overmore than a month during the previous session

item.title: Cost-cutting pays off at Home Depot
item.description: The world’s largest home improvement retailer reported better-than-expected results for the second quarter as cost-cutting offset falling demand from cash-strapped consumers

item.title: Downturn slows tide of US-bound workers
item.description: Declining prospects of finding a job are prompting many Mexicans to return home

item.title: China and Australia sign energy deal
item.description: China and Australia have agreed a $41bn energy deal at a time when tensions between the two trading partners were running high

item.title: Cargill quarterly profits plunge by 69%
item.description: Cargill, the US agribusiness conglomerate, reported that its fiscal full-year earnings fell for the first time in eight years and warned that it expects the effects of the global economic downturn to persist “for some time”

item.title: US political journalist Bob Novak dies at 78
item.description: Bob Novak, a fixture in Washington print and television political journalism for nearly half a century, died from the consequences of a brain tumour at the age of 78
